intro: Hypoxis alba var. burkei, commonly known as the white star ginger, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are often arranged in a star-like pattern, giving it its common name. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
